problem.markdown: >>Why is the coefficient of variation (CV) useful? << () It is analogous to the variance of a set of data. (x) It gives a sense of how much a data set varies normalized by how big or small the values generally are. () It can be multiplied with the variance to obtain the standard deviation. [Explanation] The coefficient of variation is the standard deviation of a data set normalized (divided) by the mean of that set. A standard deviation of 2 mm may be huge when considering pencil lead diameters but would be tiny when considering the length of a firehose. Normalizing by the mean of the dataset gives a better sense towards whether this variation is actually large or not in the context of interest. [Explanation]
